oai_dc:dc.dc:title: United Primitive Baptist Church, 2000 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of United Primitive Baptist Church located at 2911 Clifton Road (now Avenue) in Nashville, Tennessee. Now reportedly being used as a duplex home with barbecue smoking equipment in the back, this structure began as St. Phillip's African Methodist Episcopal Church in 1913. By 1930, the address was listed as Benevolent Hall. In the late 1930s the name changed to St. John's Union Baptist Church, quickly followed by another slight name change in 1940 to St. John's United Primitive Baptist Church. By 1954 the address no longer appeared in the directories. The building has a block foundation. The exterior walls are cinder block. The roof is gabled with shingles. Storm windows have been installed. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
